sub_topic: Applying the Fourier transform to signal processing
message_1:
In signal processing, a signal x(t) is given by 

$$x(t) = 3\sin(2\pi 50 t) + 4\cos(2\pi 150 t) + 2\sin(2\pi 300 t)$$

Determine the frequency components of this signal using Fourier transform.
message_2:
To determine the frequency components of the given signal x(t), we can observe that it is already in the sum of sinusoids form, which represents the individual frequency components directly. In this case, we don't need to compute the Fourier transform explicitly.

The given signal x(t) is:

$$x(t) = 3\sin(2\pi 50 t) + 4\cos(2\pi 150 t) + 2\sin(2\pi 300 t)$$

From this expression, we can identify the frequency components as follows:

1. A sinusoidal component with amplitude 3 and frequency 50 Hz: $$3\sin(2\pi 50 t)$$
2. A cosine component with amplitude 4 and frequency 150 Hz: $$4\cos(2\pi 150 t)$$
3. A sinusoidal component with amplitude 2 and frequency 300 Hz: $$2\sin(2\pi 300 t)$$

So, the frequency components of the signal x(t) are 50 Hz, 150 Hz, and 300 Hz.
